subject: Public Speaking
title: Hiroshima and Truman's Announcement
description: A short lesson to help you apply Hiroshima and Truman's Announcement.

hook.text: On August 6, 1945, Truman announced that America had dropped an atomic bomb. His tone was chillingly calm.

buildup.text: He described the bomb as harnessing the basic power of the universe and warned Japan of further destruction.

discovery.text: The speech framed mass destruction as scientific achievement. Language sanitized an event that killed 80,000 instantly.

twist.text: Truman never publicly expressed doubt. But his private diary shows he was horrified by what he had authorized.

climax.text: The announcement showed how official language can make the unthinkable sound rational and even necessary.

punchline.text: The most destructive act was announced in the calmest voice.

quiz.question: How did Truman's announcement frame the atomic bomb?
options: As a scientific achievement and military necessity
